tp.pr3

Class NavigationModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr3.NavigationModule

  • public class NavigationModule
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is in charge of the robot navigation features. It contains the city where the robot looks for garbage, the current place where the robot is, and the current direction of the robot. It contains methods to handle the different robot movements and to pick and drop items at the current place.

      Navigation module constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NavigationModule

        public NavigationModule(City aCity,
                Place initialPlace)
        Navigation module constructor. It needs the city map and the initial place
        Parameters:
        aCity - A city map
        initialPlace - An initial place for the robot

    • Method Detail

      • atSpaceship

        public boolean atSpaceship()
        Checks if the robot has arrived at a spaceship
        Returns:
        true if an only if the current place is the spaceship

      • rotate

        public void rotate(Rotation rotation)
        Updates the current direction of the robot according to the rotation
        Parameters:
        rotation - left or right

      • move

        public void move()
          throws InstructionExecutionException
        The method tries to move the robot following the current direction. If the movement is not possible because there is no street, or there is a street which is closed, then it throws an exception. Otherwise the current place is updated according to the movement
        Throws:
        InstructionExecutionException - An exception with a message about the encountered problem

      • pickItemFromCurrentPlace

        public Item pickItemFromCurrentPlace(java.lang.String id)
        Tries to pick an item characterized by a given identifier from the current place. If the action was completed the item is removed from the current place.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier of the item
        Returns:
        The item of identifier id if it exists in the place. Otherwise the method returns null

      • dropItemAtCurrentPlace

        public void dropItemAtCurrentPlace(Item it)
        Drop an item in the current place. It assumes that there is no other item with the same name/id there. Otherwise, the behaviour is undefined.
        Parameters:
        item - The name of the item to be dropped.

      • findItemAtCurrentPlace

        public boolean findItemAtCurrentPlace(java.lang.String id)
        Checks if there is an item with a given id in this place
        Parameters:
        id - Identifier of the item we are looking for
        Returns:
        true if and only if an item with this id is in the current place

      • initHeading

        public void initHeading(Direction heading)
        Initializes the current heading according to the parameter
        Parameters:
        heading - New direction for the robot

      • scanCurrentPlace

        public void scanCurrentPlace()
        Prints the information (description + inventory) of the current place

      • getHeadingStreet

        public Street getHeadingStreet()
        Returns the street opposite the robot
        Returns:
        The street which the robot is facing, or null, if there is not any street in this direction

      • getCurrentHeading

        public Direction getCurrentHeading()
        Returns the robot heading
        Returns:
        The direction where the robot is facing to.

      • getCurrentPlace

        public Place getCurrentPlace()
        Returns the current place where the robot is (for testing purposes)
        Returns:
        The current place
